author: curiousvenombi
body:
https://fintel.io/doc/sec-ktov-6k-kitov-pharamceuticals-holdings-2020-july-01-18444

Kitov Pharma Ltd. (the “Company” or the “Registrant”) is announcing that it has published a Notice of an Extraordinary General Meeting of the Shareholders of the Company to be held on Thursday, August 6, 2020, at 4:30 p.m. Israel time, at the offices of the Company, One Azrieli Center, Round Tower, 19th Floor, 132 Menachem Begin Road, Tel Aviv, Israel. The Notice of Extraordinary General Meeting of Shareholders is attached to this Form 6-K as Exhibit 99.1.
  
This report on Form 6-K, including the Notice of Extraordinary General Meeting of Shareholders, will also be submitted to the Israel Securities Authority and Tel Aviv Stock Exchange and available on their respective websites for listed company reports at www.magna.isa.gov.il and www.maya.tase.co.il, and will also be made available on the Company’s corporate website at http://kitovpharma.investorroom.com/Shareholder-Meetings.
 
The Proxy Statement for the Extraordinary General Meeting of Shareholders, together with the accompanying voting instruction form and voting slip (collectively, the “Proxy Materials”), is expected to be furnished to the Securities and Exchange Commission (the “SEC”) on Form 6-K on or around July 2, 2020, and will be available to the public on the SEC’s website at http://www.sec.gov. The Proxy Materials will also be submitted to the Israel Securities Authority and Tel Aviv Stock Exchange and available on their respective websites for listed company reports, and will also be made available on the Company’s corporate website. 
 
Following publication by the Company of the Proxy Materials, BNY Mellon, the Depositary of the Company’s American Depositary Shares (“ADSs”) program will distribute a Voting Instruction Form for holders of the Company’s ADSs, which will be distributed to holders of the Company’s ADSs by BNY Mellon, and a copy of which will be furnished to the SEC on Form 6-K and will also be submitted by the Company to the Israel Securities Authority and Tel Aviv Stock Exchange and available on the respective websites for listed company reports. ADS holders should return their BNY Mellon Voting Instruction Form by no later than 12:00 P.M. EST on July 31, 2020.
 
Information contained on, or that can be accessed through, the Company’s website does not constitute a part of this Form 6-K, nor does it form part of the proxy solicitation materials in connection with the meeting. The Company has included its website address in this Form 6-K solely as an inactive textual reference. The Company will post on its website any materials in connection with the meeting required to be posted on such website under applicable corporate or securities laws and regulations.
 
This report on Form 6-K of the Registrant consists of the following documents, which are attached hereto and incorporated by reference herein:
 
Exhibits
 
99.1	 	Notice of Extraordinary General Meeting of Shareholders of Kitov Pharma Ltd.

People who don’t have homes, don’t have money in the bank, and struggling to pay bills or eat are going to be hit hard and those rich people still depend on them...and if our stock market were to really crash, it would completely effect our economy I have no idea what your talking about.. these are huge publicly traded companies that have a huge impact on our overall economy and create massive amounts of jobs and many people in this country depend on so don’t tel me it doesn’t have an impact that’s just false...

author: harry_kalas
body:
Jobless numbers are such an outdated metric to follow for the market. Yes, the poor are struggling. Take a drive into your nearest metropolitan’s richest suburbs. No changes. Doctors, lawyers, executives...all fine. Working for these people, I’ve never been more busy. They’re bored and rich at home. 

All the jobless numbers tel us at this point is that some rich people are saving some money by laying off poor people, and then going to target to spend their savings

author: Cdmphoenix13
body:
I get what you’re saying. A lot of it has to do with what, if any PR comes out though. Basically a share on NASDAQ is now worth 10 of the companies shares on the Tel Aviv Stock Exchange. One follows the other’s price and remains more or less equivalent to the other factoring in the exchange rate. 40 cent moves would be much faster/possible now I think. If you look at it like “it struggled to move $4” it makes more sense why it didn’t move easily.

Some people say that this stock being close to out of penny stock range now will bring in investors who wouldn’t want to mess with a 50 cent stock. My bags want me to believe that, but anyone like that is going to look into the history of the stock and see that it’s just a penny stock with the ratio changed to maintain compliance. I think it could do a run. The dilution of the stock is the same, the market cap doesn’t change. I believed in this at one point but man does my ass hurt from the fucking I’ve been getting lately.

author: Kevinement
body:
If you’re honestly looking into starting to save money, I wouldn’t recommend blowing it in trades. Day-Trading is a super risky business even for well-experiences stock market experts.  
Just buy broadly diversified ETFs with low TER, like an MSCI World and use the buy and hold strategy.

There’s a reason why Wall Street gets constantly jokes about blowing all their money. It’s not a joke.

Given the high tax over dividends in my country, and given that I want to hold my positions for a long time, I was looking for an accumulating ETF that tracked the S&P500 and purchasable through Degiro.

I was looking at **iShares Core S&P 500 UCITS ETF** and the page looked good, didn't see any red flags, and the TER isn't terribly high. Also it's available through my broker (Degiro).

Does anyone have any idea if this is a good option?

Thanks a lot!!

author: Kbarbs4421
body:
I'm coming around on Terrascend.  I like that their investment capex for expansion is nearly complete. As they bring these markets online and/or ramp their footprints, financial performance should be quite strong relative to peers.  I also like the Canopy relationship, and have noted their increasing preference to discuss Terrascend rather than Acreage.  It certainly feels like Terrascend is viewed as a winning investment by CGC.

I finally opened a modest position in TRSSF earlier this week, right at the recent support level.  I have a couple of deeper limit buys set should support fail.  If pps holds and climbs from here, I don't feel the need to chase.  As one of the best positioned companies outside of the top tier, I'm happy to have a bit of exposure going into this phase of MSO growth.

That said, I'm channeling the lessons I learned during the LP bubble.  In particular, I'm committed to taking profit and closing out positions on mid-tier names when things get nuts.  Terrascend is not a long hold for me, barring some sort of major shift in strategy or success.  When the US cannacraze happens, I'm going to winnow my exposure down to a couple of core long positions in the best run companies at that time.  Even if TER is looking really good mid-bubble, I'm going to accept that for the win it is and move on with my gains.  I'm not going to ride over the top of another wave holding onto underdogs.

FWIW, I think it's important to note that Terrascend is beholden to two major insiders (Canopy and JW Asset Management).  So much so that common shareholders are certainly an after thought.  Also, so much so that those insiders should be viewed skeptically as possible vultures looking to force a takeover in the end.  In other words, Terrascend may prove to be a good company that's not a great investment for the common shareholder.  It's important not to lose sight of that as a possibility.

author: ZombehArmyLTD
body:
Youre like 4 years too late to make a million but youll still do good if you invest in some of the best tickers at the right averages.

Canadian side, only APHA sub C6$, or WEED sub C20$.
Stateside, CURA sub C9$, TRUL sub C20$ and GTII sub C16$. 

Some YOLO plays for me would be PLTH sub C3$, TER sub C5$.

Id wait it out. This sub seems to think itll run all the way until legalization.. i dont believe it but, you can bet with them. Youll probably be fine if you know how to take profits when they come. 

Id kick the millionaire thoughts out the door unless you plan on holding for 15+ years. 

Good luck!

author: wegwerf874
body:
There are enough UCITS-compliant ETF you can buy from the EU which are basically equivalent to VOO or VTI but without all the tax-related cross-border hassle (these are highly non-trivial for ETFs, just filing a W8-BEN won't be enough). Their TER are also as low as 0,07%. Of course, you will have currency issues, i.e. the value per share which is often denominated in EUR will vary depending on the exchange rate, but so would it be if you bought shares at a US-based broker. You can also see exchange rates as a virtue: Currently, for example, all US shares are on a 10% discount for Europeans, compared with a few months ago.

Just look into EU-based products by, e.g., iShares (Blackrock), x-trackers (Deutsche), Vanguard, SPDR etc. pp.

body:
Probably something @el_mercenary said. He's smart as fuck and I have been rebalancing to mimic some of his plays. He loves David and is extremely bullish on SaaS and 5g - SE, FSLY, DDOG, AYX, CRWD, NET, TER, etc. Check his post history he made like a mil holding Shop and others for 3 -4 years. 

What's your largest holding? And do you have a PT for SE?

author: radarbot
body:
This is kind of my strategy too. I have a few different piles based on doing research of active invested fund portfolios, industry trends and my own gut feeling:

1. Cloud computing (ie. NET, FSLY, etc)
2. Digital communications (ie. TWLO, BAND, ORBC, NOK etc)
3. Modernized Healthcare (ie. CRSP, NVTA, ARCT, TDOC, LVGO, etc)
4. Renewable Energy (ie. SPWR, SEDG, RUN, BEP, NEE, etc)
5. Ecommerce (ie. SQ, V, PYPL, etc)
6. Tech hardware (ie. AMD, AMAT, MU, TSM, TER,)

I've tried a DCA average into most of these stocks, but the current run up has been savage on my mental strain as some of these stocks are moving much faster than I expected, which is fucking with my DCA strategy.

Thanks for your response, I think we're all in the same boat and its all about discipline in this whacky market.

author: thorprodigy
body: For the next 6 months I believe CL and GTII offer the best returns. I would add CURA if we get news of adult use in NY, CT, NJ or if we were to get uplisting news.  CURA is a bit bloated but a definite watch.  TRUL could be another consideration if it were to acquire more licenses through a CCHW or TER.

author: daccord_cava
body:
that's right, the expensive ones will keep getting more expensive (it remains to be seen whether they'll retain their valuations tho)

i think we've all gotten accustomed to seeing sympathy runs on turds just because they're "in the sector" but there does seem to be some separation occurring (`MMEN` for example)...

i do think there are still some diamonds in the rough out there that have some arb in them... toddo just mentioned `AYR.A` but last i checked their execution still looked like trash...

there's been a lot of mention of `TER` by him as well and they did well with their recent pre-announcement, but all I remember about `TER` is their former-founder's twitter-fights and the shit-ass liquidity (plus i think it's still majority-controlled by the one family-fund)... price-action doesn't lie though so maybe there's something to it... i should look into them

author: Lowerlameland
body: Would be nice for TER, so it's a good rumour to start, but regardless, TER MC is only 600m Canadian, so there's room to grow for sure if the US stuff keeps going. Or if the big guys cool off, maybe money will move to a few smaller companies who are doing ok? Not sure it'll work that way. Their earnings are next Thursday and should be good anyway...
